casebody.data:
Eric Dewayne CURTIS
v.
MICHELS CORPORATION, et al. No. 2019-C-543 Supreme Court of Louisiana. June 3, 2019 ON WRIT OF CERTIORARI TO THE COURT OF APPEAL, THIRD CIRCUIT, PARISH OF ALLEN Writ denied. HUGHES, J., additionally concurs and assigns reasons. Hughes, J., additionally concurs and assigns reasons. Any dismissal not specifically designated "with prejudice" is considered to be "without prejudice." See La.C.C.P. art. 1673 ; State ex rel. Dep't of Soc. Serv. v. A.P. , 02-2372 (La. App. 1 Cir. 6/20/03), 858 So.2d 498 ("[w]hen the judgment is silent as to whether it is being dismissed with or without prejudice, the dismissal must be without prejudice.")
